sentence: U.S. stocks were set to open June in the red after data showed that manufacturing activity in China slowed in May, weighing on oil, mining and industrial stocks.
Asia closed lower while European markets also traded down.
West Texas Intermediate crude oil was down 1.2% at $48.50 recently while Brent Crude was lower 1.3% at $49.23.
In domestic data, the final PMI manufacturing index, out at 9:45 a.m. E.T.
is expected to have edged down to 50.5 for May compared to April, but unchanged from the flash reading.
The consensus range is between 50.4 and 51.1, according to data compiled by Econoday.
At 10:00 a.m., the ISM manufacturing index is seen lower at 50.6 for May from 50.8 in April, in the consensus range between 49.9 and 51.0.

Also at 10:00 a.m., data is expected to show that construction spending in April rose 0.6% compared to the 0.3% increase in March and in the consensus range between a 0.1% increase and a 0.9% increase.
In equities, Michael Kors ( KORS ) shares rose over 7% in pre-market trade after the fashion company's fiscal Q4 results exceeded estimates.
Meanwhile, Demandware ( DWRE ) shares surged over 56% after Salesforce.com ( CRM ) agreed to acquire the firm for $75 per share or $2.8 billion.

CRM was down 2%

(+) GALE (+17.7%) Gets FDA fast track status for NeuVax to treat breast cancer

(-) BABA (-3.6%) Softbank to cut holding to 28% vs 32% through share sale

(-) NKE (-3.4%) Says some 'conflict minerals' in shoes may come from Democratic Republic of Congo, neighboring countries
